abstractText: Count of qualifying large wood pieces (>0.10m diameter, 1.0m length) at a site,standardized to a count per 100 m of bankfull length.Wetted Large Wood Frequency is the number (per 100 m) of qualifying pieces within the wetted channel at a site. A portion of the main stem oor root extending into the wettedchannel must be >0.10m diameter.BankfullLarge Wood Frequency is the number (per 100 m) of qualifying pieces within the bankfullchannel at a site. A portion of the main stem or root extending into the bankfull channel must be >0.10m diameter.The CHaMP - Large Woody Debris (lwd) Method provides background on enumeration of large woody debris that are analyzed for this calculation. See - http://www.monitoringmethods.org/Method/Details/4165
title: Large Wood Frequency v1.0
